bug.short_desc: Add option to toggle mixins in api viewer

long_desc.thetext:
In the api viewer, there's currently no way to hide members that were included from a mixin.
It would be nice to be able to toggle display of included members. This could work the same as how inherited members can currently be toggled.
Sounds like a good idea, thanks. :)

Great to see that this feature has been added. :)
However, personally I don't like the pulldown menu that much, because the menu button does not give any visual feedback about the current state (contrary to the toggle buttons).
A possible improvement I can think of would be to change the icon of the includes-menu, based on which options have been selected.
Gabriel, could you take care of that. Different icons could really improve the usability here.

i can see the point. i agree. maybe i will choose a totally different widget, as i cannot see what to do now when both the inherited and mixins are selected. what should the menu button show to the user?

I think the most obvious choice would be to have the menu button show the same icons as that are currently shown in front of the inherited/included methods in the API viewer.
In case both options have been checked, the menu button could show a combined icon with both the "up" arrow (inherited) and the "top-right" arrow (included). But this might get cumbersome if you would ever want to add more options to the menu.
What's the reason that you moved the items into a menu instead of adding a new toggle button for mixin members?

Adding to my previous comment:
I ment a combination of the images: - method_public_inherited18.gif - overlay_mixin18.gif Found in the apiviewer resources.

the reason was that the number of toggle buttons was too great, and i wanted these filters to occupy the right end of the toolbar, not all of it. plus, inherited and mixins filters have similar meaning - something external of the class is inserted into the doc viewer.
